featured.text: The Maasai are a semi-nomadic group in Kenya and northern Tanzania, wandering in bands and living almost entirely on the meat, blood, and milk of their herds.
A Maasai warrior is rarely seen without his spear and shield.
In Kenya, researchers found that elephants react differently to clothing worn by men of the Maasai and Kamba ethnic groups.
Beadwork is an important part of Maasai culture.

other.text: In an experiment conducted by animal scientists, elephants were first presented with clean clothing or clothing that had been worn for five days by either a Maasai or a Kamba man.
What can we learn from the passage about the Maasai people?
Which of the following is true about Maasai clothing and beadwork?

When the elephants detected the smell of clothing worn by a Maasai man, they moved away from the smell faster and took longer to relax than when they detected the smells of either clothing worn by Kamba men or clothing that had not been worn at all.
Maasai clothing varies with age, gender, and place.
In the same study, when the elephants saw red clothing not worn before, they reacted angrily, as red is typically worn by Maasai men.
Young Maasai men spear animals and thus pose a threat to elephants; Kamba men are mainly farmers and are not a danger to elephants.
To explain how Maasai warriors hunt for deer in the wild.
Up until recently, the only way for a Maasai boy to achieve warrior status was to single-handedly kill a lion with his spear.
Which of the following pictures best represents the image of a typical Maasai warrior? (A) (B) (C) (D) 36.
According to the passage, which of the following statements is true about Kamba and Maasai people? (A) Maasai people are a threat to elephants.
To exemplify the types of weapons used by Maasai warriors.

definition.zh_def: 馬賽人，東非的一個游牧民族，以其獨特的文化和傳統著稱。
definition.en_def: The Maasai are a semi-nomadic ethnic group in East Africa known for their distinctive customs and dress.
definition.example: The Maasai people are famous for their vibrant beadwork and traditional dances.
